image.altText: Narrator and Producer Leonardo DiCaprio.

props.synopsis: A dead fish used as a prop in the Senate, a Hollywood superstar's intervention and Labor being shouted at as a "pack of mongrels" all feature on the day a new law to protect salmon farm jobs in Tasmania was being debated.

title.children: How a Greens senator brought a dead fish into the Senate as DiCaprio weighed in from the US

image.altText: The front of a Jeanswest store with mannequins in the windows.

props.synopsis: Clothing retailer Jeanswest has collapsed, with more than 90 stores set to close within months and hundreds of employees set to lose their jobs.

title.children: Clothing retailer Jeanswest collapses, hundreds of jobs to go

image.altText: A close up of laptop screen

props.synopsis: A proposed ban on-compete clauses in employment contracts was a centrepiece of the budget. But what are they, how do they work, and why do most economists think they are bad for workers and the economy?

title.children: What are non-compete clauses and why are economists so keen to abolish them?

image.altText: A police officer stands at a camera tripod in front of a crime scene and police car.

props.synopsis: A further three teenagers have been charged with murder following a fatal stabbing in Melbourne's south-east last week.

title.children: Three more charged with murder after Melbourne south-east stabbing

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump wearing a white shirt, blue suit jacket and yellow tie

props.synopsis: One man appears to be the last remaining hurdle between Australia and the soft economic landing that the federal government and Reserve Bank have been angling for.

title.children: Budget forecasts may be blown away by Trump tariff war

image.altText: An illustration of a strange dinosaur

props.synopsis: Scientists say the Duonychus is like a "giant feathered sloth" with "big, sharp and nasty claws".

title.children: Workers uncover 'weird' dinosaur in the Gobi Desert. What do we know?

image.altText: woman lying down clutching a hot water bottle to her abdomen

props.synopsis: The changes included may save some women "thousands of dollars across their lifetimes", according to budget documents.

title.children: Women’s health a 'national priority' as budget unveils $793m investment

image.altText: Women hold signs that read 'March 4 Justice' and 'Enough is Enough' at a rally protesting the treatment of women in politics

props.synopsis: Interviewees were granted anonymity to discuss their experiences, with 150 women telling their stories about the abuse they had received in politics.

title.children: 'Show me your underwear, I'll vote for you': Women in politics reveal abuse

image.altText: Prince Harry smiles in front of Sentebale branding, wearing a khaki button-up shirt

props.synopsis: The prince says the trustees asked the chair to step down but she refused and sued the charity. She says her lawsuit has merit and calls herself a whistleblower against "abuse of power" and "misogynoir".

title.children: Prince Harry resigns from charity after 'unthinkable' dispute with chair

image.altText: An aerial photo of a school in Armidale.

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old woman is jailed for resisting and intimidating police, following a dispute involving two girls at an Armidale high school in which staff were allegedly assaulted.

title.children: Woman embroiled in school dispute given 12-month jail term on same day

image.altText: The Paddington Bear statue after it was recovered by Newbury Police.

props.synopsis: The pair drunkenly stole the statue in the early hours of the morning before fleeing in a taxi to the RAF base they live on.

title.children: RAF engineers admit damage and theft of beloved Paddington Bear statue in UK

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump speaking in front of the red and white stripes of a US flag.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump defends the top adviser who inadvertently looped a magazine editor into a war group chat, saying he'd "learned a lesson" from the "glitch".

title.children: 'Learned a lesson': Trump defends aide's group chat 'glitch'

image.altText: Orange flames seen from an aerial vantage point.

props.synopsis: Multiple wildfires are raging across South Korea's south-eastern region, with thousands of firefighters aided by the military deployed in a bid to contain one of the country's worst forest fires in decades.

title.children: South Korean wildfires see thousands evacuate, death toll climbs to 18

image.altText: silouette of crisafulli with gabba lights in the background

props.synopsis: Athletics Australia has accused the Queensland government of "overlooking" track and field in its Brisbane Olympics plan, saying the sport will receive "no legacy benefits" beyond the 2032 Games.

title.children: Brisbane to become the only capital that can't host national athletics

props.synopsis: The Albanese government has delivered its final budget ahead of an election in May, with a fresh new round of tax cuts the major offer. Find out who else is set to benefit and who may miss out.

title.children: Find out if you're among the budget's winners or losers

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A wide shot of a large wire fence outside Perth's Hakea Prison with a prison building visible in the background.

props.synopsis: A WA prisoner who died in hospital after fatally self-harming in his jail cell could be alive today had authorities responded appropriately to his calls for mental health support, a coronial inquest finds.

title.children: 'Perfect storm' led to 22yo Indigenous prisoner taking own life, coroner finds

image.altText: Five staff members of a resort stand on the beach and wave happily with their left hands

props.synopsis: Yes, there is yet another streaming service arriving on our shores. But things are a little different with this one, and it could up-end the Australian TV landscape.

title.children: HBO's streaming service is coming to Australia. It could change everything

image.altText: A pile of dusty, worn out and damaged typres on a patch of dirt with a green tree behind it on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: About 10,000 tyres have been found at an illegal dump at Lockwood South, near Bendigo, sparking a statewide operation by the EPA.

title.children: More than 100 businesses linked to illegal tyre stockpile near Bendigo

image.altText: Six different hands reach towards a contactless pay point on public transport, each paying in a different way.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into Canberra's troubled MyWay+ ticketing system has been told the personal details of public transport users were likely accessible on the internet before and after its launch.

title.children: Inquiry into botched MyWay+ rollout hears personal details were accessible online

image.altText: A picture taken looking across a cricket ground, with the crowd, then the players and a light tower and apartments.

props.synopsis: The Gabba has been left behind by Australia's other marquee stadiums, but is also a place where sporting magic happens, with memories that will survive the much-needed move to Victoria Park.

title.children: The Gabba's long farewell will see Brisbane grow up, but lose some of itself

image.altText: A photo of Chris Habiyakare.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge says he's "far from persuaded" that a killer is sorry for shooting a young rapper dead during a home invasion in Melbourne's west four years ago.

title.children: Judge not convinced of killer's remorse after shooting young rapper

image.altText: A crowd safety officer looks over the crowd at Summernats 2024 in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Two security guards who punched patrons in a brawl at Summernats have escaped jail time, with a judge labelling the situation as "highly volatile".

title.children: Summernats guards avoid jail after punching patrons in festival brawl

image.altText: Linden Hall runs ahead of two other competitors.

props.synopsis: Three-time Australian Olympian Linden Hall is concerned by World Athletics proposing the introduction of chromosome testing for female athletes at future events.

title.children: 'Really tricky space': Aussie Olympian worried by chromosome testing proposal

image.altText: A man standing in front of a blue painting smiles gently

props.synopsis: Monash University has indefinitely postponed an exhibition — due to open in May — featuring the work of Lebanese Australian artist Khaled Sabsabi at its gallery, MUMA.

title.children: Dumped Venice Biennale artist's Melbourne show indefinitely postponed

image.altText: Grey, blue, pink and yellow egg cartons sit for sale on a shelf

props.synopsis: After making the price of eggs a key election issue, Donald Trump is importing them from as far away as Türkiye and South Korea to tackle continuing shortages.

title.children: Donald Trump is shopping for hundreds of millions of eggs

image.altText: Close up of a collection of jagged red rocks. In the background, two towers spitting flames.

props.synopsis: Woodside says a decision to further delay approval for its major gas project in WA's north west until after the federal election is "extremely disappointing".

title.children: Decision on major gas project in WA's north-west delayed again

image.altText: Pete Hegseth is surrounded by reporters holding microphones and phones.

props.synopsis: End-to-end encrypted messaging app Signal is secure for everyday use but shouldn't be used by government officials to have conversations regarding national security, cyber security experts say.

title.children: Signal is 'as safe as messaging apps get', but not for national security

image.altText: Jim Chalmers holds his arms out while speaking at a press conference at parliament house

props.synopsis: The forecasts in the federal budget paint a rosy picture of the future, claiming the mythical "soft landing" is "increasingly likely" for Australia's economy.

title.children: Is Australia's economy on track for a 'soft landing'? The budget papers say it is

image.altText: A view of the Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: Whyalla steelworks administrator KordaMentha says it has identified up to a dozen "interested parties" as it seeks to secure a sale of the business by the end of the year, and has also praised the "MacGyver-like" ingenuity of local workers contending with a plant in need of repair.

title.children: Whyalla's 'MacGyver-like' steelworkers praised as site on track for sale

image.altText: A small grey shark with yellowish spots along its body viewed from above against a black background.

props.synopsis: Sharks were thought to be silent, but scientists have recorded a New Zealand species making a clicking noise.

title.children: Sharks recorded making sounds underwater for the first time

image.altText: An area of dead trees and vegetation

props.synopsis: Traditional owners and a scientist fear there have been more fracking chemical spills by gas companies exploring the Northern Territory's Beetaloo Basin.

title.children: 'It killed everything': Scientist assesses chemical spills at NT fracking site

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: South Australians living with a disability have reportedly had their hands shackled with rope, their wheelchair tyres punctured and food withheld by family members and carers, the state's domestic violence royal commission has heard.

title.children: People living with disability subjected to 'terrible things', DV royal commission hears

image.altText: A sign outside Alcoa's Kwinana alumina refinery next to a road leading into the industrial buildings

props.synopsis: Aluminium giant Alcoa is fined $400,000 over an incident where workers and school students were burned by an "uncontrolled discharge of hot caustic solution" at its Kwinana refinery in WA.

title.children: Alcoa fined over 'very serious' chemical burns to work experience students

image.altText: A wall of portraits with one removed

props.synopsis: It's unknown when the oil painting, criticised by Mr Trump as "purposefully distorted" and "truly the worst", will be replaced.

title.children: Trump's portrait removed from Colorado's state capitol
